author: VNExplorer
title: Alok Industries witnesses 20% surge as RIL Invests Rs 3,300 Crore through preferential shares
text:
Alok Industries witnesses 20% surge as RIL invests Rs 3,300 Crore through preferential shares. {Photo: Facebook}
On January 2, the shares of Alok Industries experienced a remarkable surge, climbing 20 percent and hitting its upper circuit at Rs 25.80. This peak marked the stock’s highest level in the past 52 weeks. The rally was ignited by a significant investment move from Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL), which subscribed to non-convertible redeemable preferential shares amounting to Rs 3,300 crore.
The preferential shares were issued to RIL at an attractive dividend rate of 9% through a private placement basis. Notably, these preferential shares hold the feature of being redeemable at par anytime within a maximum period of 20 years from the date of allotment.
Also Read
Oil jumps 1.5% in New Year after U.S. forces repel Houthis in Red Sea This investment announcement led to a surge in trading activity, with an impressive 11 crore shares changing hands on the exchanges. This volume is notably higher than the one-month daily traded average of 4 crore shares, underscoring the heightened investor interest in Alok Industries. Over the past month, the stock has also recorded a substantial 31 percent increase.
Reliance Industries, being a promoter in the textile manufacturing company, has a history of strategic involvement with Alok Industries. In 2020, RIL, in collaboration with JM Financial Asset Reconstruction Co, successfully acquired Alok Industries through bankruptcy proceedings. This acquisition was executed to recover the outstanding dues to creditors, solidifying RIL’s position in the textile sector.
Also Read SBI, ONGC, Sunteck Realty, Coal India Dalmia Bharat top picks for Motilal Oswal in 2024
As of the end of the September quarter, RIL held a substantial 40.01 percent stake in Alok Industries, while JM Financial Asset Reconstruction Co owned a noteworthy 34.99 percent stake. This recent move by Reliance Industries not only highlights its ongoing commitment to Alok Industries but also positions the textile company for potential growth and strategic developments in the coming years.
Investors and industry observers are keenly watching how this infusion of funds and strategic support from Reliance Industries will impact the future trajectory of Alok Industries, as both entities continue to collaborate and navigate the dynamics of the textile sector.

author: Rajan
title: "Master of genre bending is at it again"- Internet reacts to the latest Mickey 17 trailer featuring Robert Pattinson
text:
') > -1) { addClass($('.section-container'), 'pill-tag'); } Follow Us Share 0 Discuss 0 Discuss What's your opinion? "Master of genre bending is at it again"- Internet reacts to the latest Mickey 17 trailer featuring Robert Pattinson Discuss Now A still from Micky 17 (Image via Warner Bros. Pictures) Mickey 17 , an upcoming science fiction black comedy directed by Bong Joon-ho, has been generating significant buzz online. Adapted from Edward Ashton’s 2022 novel Mickey7 , the film stars Robert Pattinson as Mickey Barnes, a disposable employee who regenerates after death.
The story follows Mickey’s unexpected survival during a mission to colonize the icy planet Niflheim and his confrontation with a new iteration, Mickey 18. The highly anticipated film will premiere at the 75th Berlin International Film Festival in February 2025 before opening in South Korea on February 28 and in the US on March 7, 2025.
The recently released Mickey 17 trailer has generated buzz on social media. Twitter has seen fans praising the interesting plot, the visuals, and Robert Pattinson's performance. A fan tweeted:
Trending “Master of genre bending is at it again…,” referring to Bong Joon-ho's signature style. Expand Tweet This comment was echoed by many who expressed excitement about the movie’s premise and cast.
“Looks compelling!!” one person said . “I’m intrigued! Interesting plot. Looking forward to it!” another person said . Some praised Pattinson’s performance and said:
“This looks great and Robert Pattinson’s accent is amazing and different. I had no idea he was that great at accents,” another netizen said . “Ever since he did Batman, he has been a dope actor.”, another fan highlighted his career evolution. The overall sentiment points to immense anticipation for Mickey 17 . The movie’s connection to the novel also sparked interest, with one netizen tweeting :
“Looking forward to it! I enjoyed the novel.” “So excited, man! Hype is real,” another netizen said . All About Mickey 17 Expand Tweet Plot and production Mickey 17 tells the story of Mickey Barnes, an "expendable" who regenerates after death while retaining his memories. After surviving a near-fatal incident on Niflheim, Mickey faces unexpected challenges, including a new version of himself, Mickey 18. Its plot blends science fiction and dark comedy, adding to Bong Joon-ho's impressive filmography.
The movie features a talented cast that includes Naomi Ackie, Steven Yeun, Toni Collette, and Mark Ruffalo. Filming started in August 2022 at Warner Bros. Studios in Leavesden and finished in December 2022. Bong Joon-ho, who is famous for the movie Parasite , wrote, directed, and produced this film. Charles Yu also helped with the writing.
Release and anticipation The SAG-AFTRA strike caused delays for the movie, but it is set for release in early 2025. Its premiere at the Berlin International Film Festival marks much-awaited excitement among fans. High expectations have been created by Robert Pattinson's acting and Bong Joon-ho's visionary reputation as director.

author: Gene Fitzgerald
title: Letter: Has the LDS Church divested itself from an investment linked to the ‘Hamas money machine’?
text:
A recent New York Times there article — titled “Israel found the Hamas money machine years ago. Nobody turned it off.” — depicts how Hamas was funded generally and then how the money was used to finance its operations. The article concentrates primarily on Turkey’s involvement, but also on many Western investments.
Of particular local interest is the following report: “Foreign investors piled in [in a real estate development firm named Trend GYO, a company found to be at the center of the Hamas portfolio] . . . . In 2019 while Washington sat on the ledgers, American and European banks held more than 3 percent of the company’s publicly traded shares on behalf of clients, Turkish financial records show.”
The LDS church was one of those investors: “The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints’s Investment arm Ensign Peak Advisors, bought more than 200,000 shares.”
The Times does provide an excuse for the investment: “There is no indication that the church . . . knew about any Hamas ties at the time. A church spokesman said that a U.S.-based investment adviser, Acadian Asset, bought the shares on its behalf.”
Nevertheless, Israeli authorities have now concluded that this influx of money not only helped Hamas prepare for the Oct. 7 attacks, but also gave leaders confidence that they would have the money to rebuild afterward. This opinion was voiced by five Israeli security officials.
It is of particular interest to know who is the church spokesman, and if the LDS Church, while apparently having no knowledge of Hamas ties, has divested itself of this investment, and if so when, and if not, why not.
Gene Fitzgerald, Salt Lake City
Submit a letter to the editor
